snippet: Hospitals said they were getting ready for an influx of newly insured patients, but many health care providers said the pace was slower than usual because of the New Year’s holiday.
abstract: Consumers across the United States begin using coverage provided by the new health care law; many provisions of the law offering new benefits and protections to consumers also take effect.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and ABBY GOODNOUGH
byline.contributor: Lisa Maria Garza contributed reporting from San Antonio, and Kimiya Shokoohi from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Hospitals said they were getting ready for an influx of newly insured patients, but many health care providers said the pace was slower than usual because of the New Year’s holiday.

headline.main: Consumers Start Using Coverage Under Health Law
headline.print_headline: Consumers Start Using Coverage Under Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
